full_text:
Probable Cause Affidavit
Palm Beach Police Department
Agency ORI# FLO 500600

While in the home, I observed the pink and green couch within the master bedroom area just as the girls previously mentioned. The stair way which is located from the kitchen area to the master bedroom area is lined with photos of naked young girls. Additionally, numerous photographs of naked young females were obtained as they appeared to be photographs of the girls that had been at the house to provide massages.

Based on the facts, there is sufficient probable cause to charge Jeffrey Epstein for Unlawful Sexual Activity with a Minor 2 counts a second degree felony in direct violation of Florida State Statues 794.05(1) as Epstein had vaginal intercourse with and _____. It should be noted that both girls were minors when this occurred. There is sufficient probable cause to charge Jeffrey Epstein with Lewd and Lascivious Molestation (The Victim), a second degree felony in direct violation of Florida State Statues 800.04 (5) as the original victim was only 14 years of age when the molestation with the vibrator on her vagina area occurred.

The foregoing instrument was sworn to or affirmed before me this 23 day of November, 2005 by Det Joe Recarey, who is personally known to me.

State of Florida
County of Palm Beach

Signature/Arresting Officer
Date: 11/23/2005

Signature of Police Officer (F.S.S. 117.10)
07/26/17
Page 17 of 88
Public Records Request No.: 17-295
DOJ-OGR-00031880

additional_notes: The document appears to be a probable cause affidavit related to charges against Jeffrey Epstein. It includes details about the investigation and the charges brought against him. The document is from the Palm Beach Police Department and is dated November 23, 2005.
